result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Thomas Amwoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone.
Work with CCS. Take all medication as prescribed. DNA on file.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 10/3/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Jonathan Thomas Amwoza in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Matthias Welch in court for Jonathan Thomas Amwoza.  Attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. State orally amends ct 1 to misd battery. Jt: plea ct 1 as amended for 60 days DCJ. DE has no objection to oral motion by State. Argument. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: ct 1: misd battery: 940.19(1)

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, cc to 22CM537

CONDITIONS:

-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone

-DNA on file

-Work with CCS
-Take all medication as prescribed

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served:  0
-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC. 

Becky K
